div.div: End-User Guide for JPS Calculator App

div.div: End-User Guide for JPS Calculator App
This list of steps will show you how to use the sum up feature in the JPS Calculator app.
Here we will learn about the concept of addition.
Here you will find steps showing how to use the subtract feature on the JPS calculator app
Here we learn what subtraction means.
Here you will find steps showing how to use the multiply feature on the JPS calculator app
Here we will learn about the concept of multiplication.
Here you will find steps showing how to use the division feature on the JPS calculator app
Here we will learn the concept of division.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: This list of steps will show you how to use the sum up feature in the JPS Calculator app.
div.section: To successfully sum up numbers you should understand the concept of addition.
The result of the numbers that were added together will be shown.

You want to sum up the numbers 3 and 5. The equation will appear as 3 + 5 = 8. Enter the number 3. Then, press the plus (+) symbol. Enter the number 5. Choose the equality (=) symbol. The result appears on the screen.

div.p: Here we will learn about the concept of addition.
Addition is the process of adding one number to another.
To add, the (+) symbol must be used.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Here you will find steps showing how to use the subtract feature on the JPS calculator app

section.p: To successfully subtract numbers, you must first understand the concept of subtraction.

div.section: The subtraction result will be displayed.

You want to subtract 2 from 3. The equation will appear as 3 - 2 = 3. Enter the number 3. Press the minus symbol (-). Enter 2. Then, press the equality symbol (=).The result will appear on the screen.

div.p: Here we learn what subtraction means.
Subtraction is the process of taking one number or amount away from another.
To subtract a number from another number you must use the minus symbol.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Here you will find steps showing how to use the multiply feature on the JPS calculator app

section.p: To successfully multiply numbers, you must first understand the concept of multiplication.

div.section: The multiplication result will be displayed.

You want to multiply 2 times 7. The equation will appear as 2 * 7 = 14. Enter the number 2. Press the multiply symbol (*). Enter 7. Then, press the equality symbol (=).The result will appear on the screen.

div.p: Here we will learn about the concept of multiplication.
Multiplication is the process of adding multiple groups together in equal portions.
To multiply, the * symbol must be used.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Here you will find steps showing how to use the division feature on the JPS calculator app

section.p: To successfully divide numbers, you must first understand the concept of division.

div.section: The division result will be displayed.

You want to divide the number 6 by 2. The equation will appear as 6 / 2 = 3. Enter the number 6. Press the division symbol (/). Enter 2. Then, press the equality symbol (=).The result will appear on the screen.

div.p: Here we will learn the concept of division.
Division is the process of separating an amount into multiple lesser, equal parts.
To divide numbers the (/) symbol must be used.
